intro: Orthosiphon pseudorubicundus, commonly known as the false purple siphon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale purple or white, arranged in whorled clusters along the stem. This species is often found in wet or marshy habitats, where it thrives in humid, tropical conditions.
